intro: Cinchona officinalis var. uritusinga, commonly known as the Uritusonga quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its bark, which contains alkaloids such as quinine, historically used in the treatment of malaria. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. This variant is less commonly cultivated than other cinchona species but remains significant for its medicinal properties.
